net.viktorc.detroid.engine

Class Detroid

  • java.lang.Object
    • net.viktorc.detroid.engine.Detroid
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.util.Observer, TunableEngine, UCIEngine, ControllerEngine

    public class Detroid
extends java.lang.Object
implements ControllerEngine, TunableEngine, java.util.Observer
    A UCI compatible, tunable chess engine that utilizes magic bit boards and most search heuristics and supports Polyglot opening books.
    Author:
    Viktor

      • search

        public SearchResults search(java.util.Set<java.lang.String> searchMoves,
                            java.lang.Boolean ponder,
                            java.lang.Long whiteTime,
                            java.lang.Long blackTime,
                            java.lang.Long whiteIncrement,
                            java.lang.Long blackIncrement,
                            java.lang.Integer movesToGo,
                            java.lang.Integer depth,
                            java.lang.Long nodes,
                            java.lang.Integer mateDistance,
                            java.lang.Long searchTime,
                            java.lang.Boolean infinite)
        Description copied from interface: UCIEngine
        Prompts the engine to start searching the current position according to the specified parameters.
        Specified by:
        search in interface UCIEngine
        Parameters:
        searchMoves - A set of the moves to search at the root node in pure algebraic coordinate notation.
        ponder - Whether the engine should search in pondering mode.
        whiteTime - The time left on the clock for white in ms.
        blackTime - The time left on the clock for black in ms.
        whiteIncrement - Increment per move in ms.
        blackIncrement - Increment per move in ms.
        movesToGo - The number of moves until the next time control.
        depth - The depth to which the position should be searched. If it is 0, the engine should return the score determined by the quiescence search or if it is not implemented, the static evaluation score.
        nodes - The maximum number of nodes that should be searched.
        mateDistance - Search for a mate in x.
        searchTime - Search exactly this number of ms.
        infinite - Whether the position should be searched infinitely.
        Returns:
        The best move found and optionally the suggested ponder move in pure algebraic coordinate notation and optionally the search score and search score type.

      • stop

        public void stop()
        Description copied from interface: UCIEngine
        Prompts the engine to stop searching and return the best move found up until that point. It should cause the search method to terminate within a few milliseconds at most. If the engine is not searching at the time of the call, it should be ignored.
        Specified by:
        stop in interface UCIEngine

      • notifyParametersChanged

        public void notifyParametersChanged()
        Description copied from interface: TunableEngine
        Notifies the engine that the parameters have changed and that if it uses cached values, it should reload them. If reloading a parameter would affect a UCI setting whose current value is not the default value, it should not be reloaded. (E.g. if the hash size is defined in the parameter configuration XML file, but the UCI option "Hash" has been set to a value other than its default value, the hash size used should remain unchanged.)
        Specified by:
        notifyParametersChanged in interface TunableEngine

      • setDeterministicZeroDepthMode

        public void setDeterministicZeroDepthMode(boolean on)
        Description copied from interface: TunableEngine
        Sets whether the engine should support deterministic 0-depth search which is a quiescence search without the use of hash tables such as a transposition table or any other mechanisms that bring non-determinism to the search. A 0-depth search is triggered by calling the #search method with depth set to 0 and everything else to null while deterministic 0-depth mode is set to true. A 0-depth search is not expected to return a move, only a score. When in deterministic 0-depth mode, engines should keep their hash size minimal.
        Specified by:
        setDeterministicZeroDepthMode in interface TunableEngine
        Parameters:
        on - Whether the engine should support deterministic 0-depth search.
